title: Can you put audible books on USB? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are a subscriber to Audible, you will get 2 books each month and they are all encrypted in DRM protected technology. So the problem is, it would be meaningless if your Audible audiobooks are not playable outside the Audible app, even if you download them to your USB. Essentially, you need to make sure they are available on any of your device. And the solution we are going to provide is TunesKit Audible Converter, which is a professional converter for converting Audible books to a common format. By "convert", I mean remove the protection on the audiobooks and change them to a more acceptable format. We will break down the steps in the next paragraph. Stay tuned! How to Save Audible Audiobook to USB Step 1 Download and Import Audible Books to TunesKit Download Audible books you want to save to USB beforehand. Install and launch TunesKit Audible Converter on your computer. Both PC and Mac free versions are available on the official website. Now you can see the main interface of TunesKit, and you can begin to add audiobooks to the converter or directly drag and drop them to the main interface. TunesKit also supports converting batch of audiobook files once. Step 2Change Output Settings After the audiobook is loaded sucessfully, you can open the Format Panel and change the output settings according to your needs. The default output format is a lossless format, which will generate a DRM-free audiobook files without touching the original audio tracks at all. You can also change the output format to MP3, which is a relatively common format to all kinds of devices. Except for the format, you also can customize the audio codec, channel, sample rate and bit rate in this panel. The button "Effect" on the interface can help you adjust the volume, speed and pitch of the audiobooks. The "Edit" button to is where you can choose to split your audiobooks or to edit the tag of audiobooks. Step 3 Convert AA and AAX to Common Format When you finish step 2, simply hit on the "Convert" button and the converter will do its job, converting Audible audiobooks from AA and AAX files to the format you choose without protection anymore. When the job is done, you can click the button "Converted" to find your converted files. Step 4 Transfer Converted Audible Books to USB After you locate all the converted Audible books, you can begin to plug in the USB and copy the Audible audiobooks to the USB flash drive. Before the copy and paste, you can test if the converted audiobooks can be played on the random media player.

Yes. I use the dedicated Audible Converter to convert AAX to MP3 or AAC. The converted MP3 Audible books are movable to USB. There are many kinds of tools for choices. As far as I know, the AudKit Audible Converter could up to 100X faster speed, which could be the fastest one.

Yes. After you purchase your audiobook from Audible, you have the ability to download it to your computer. After downloading, you can then move this file to a portable USB, which you can then transport wherever you’d like.
